metadata.name: Pico Two-Player Reaction Duel
metadata.description: Press START (blue LED will arm). After a random delay, blue turns off—first player to press wins. Player A lights RED (GP18), Player B lights GREEN (GP19). Two buttons with 10kΩ pulldowns; each LED has a 220Ω series resistor.

wires.description: Provides HIGH to one side of Player A button (3D shares bus with 3E).
Player A input node (4A shares bus with 4E and 4D).
Ground for A's 10kΩ pulldown (9C shares bus with 9D).
Provides HIGH to one side of Player B button (12D shares bus with 12E).
Player B input node (13A shares bus with 13E and 13D).
Ground for B's 10kΩ pulldown (18C shares bus with 18D).
Drives READY (blue) LED through 220Ω resistor (16C shares bus with 16D).
Ground for blue LED cathode (21C shares bus with 21E).
Drives RED A-win LED via 220Ω resistor (6C shares bus with 6B).
Ground for red LED cathode (11C shares bus with 11A).
Drives GREEN B-win LED via 220Ω resistor (24C shares bus with 24D).
Ground for green LED cathode (29C shares bus with 29E).
